thread.title: Syracuse football QB Eric Dungey addresses helmet-to-helmet hit
thread.title_full: Syracuse football QB Eric Dungey addresses helmet-to-helmet hit | syracuse.com

author: Stephen Bailey | sbailey@syracuse.com
title: Syracuse football QB Eric Dungey addresses helmet-to-helmet hit
text:
Syracuse, N.Y. â€” Syracuse freshman quarterback Eric Dungey spoke with media on Tuesday for the first time since taking a helmet-to-helmet hit in the second quarter of SU's win over Central Michigan on Sept. 19.
Dungey, who missed the rest of that game and the Orange's loss to LSU a week later, returned to action on Saturday with a three-touchdown, two-turnover performance in SU's loss to South Florida.
"I just was trying to make a play," Dungey said. "Unfortunately, I took a pretty bad hit, but I don't think (CMU DE Mitch Stanitzek) was meaning to do anything bad by it. It's football. It happens. I'm just glad to be back."
Stanitzek, who was ejected for targeting, launched himself at Dungey's head after a pass was released. He connected as a Chippewas teammate was bringing Dungey down from behind.
The Orange players had mixed opinions as to whether the hit was dirty, while some SU fans were so enraged that they tweeted death threats at Stanitzek.
Dungey was less inclined to talk about the injury that resulted from the play. SU has called it no more than an upper-body injury, per usual, and generally does not report concussions until a player is medically disqualified.
SU head coach Scott Shafer said after the CMU game that he is vague about injuries to protect his players from being targeted.
"We just kind of were taking it as a hit," Dungey said when asked if he underwent concussion protocol . "I was pretty sore the next day, my back kind of contorted weird. Like I said, I'm just happy to be back."
That last phrase, "I'm just happy (or glad) to be back," was a staple of the six-minute interview, particularly after questions about the play and injury.
Dungey said the hit is part of a lesson he's learning as a college football quarterback: he can't take the same hits that he could in college.
The SU coaching staff is advising Dungey to be smarter with his feet, and he's working on balancing that with his competitive edge.
Said Dungey: "I've always tried to get every yard I can, but I really have to change that because these guys are a lot bigger than high schoolers."

Syracuse football player/coach interviews: 10/13/15 Eric Dungey 'His concussion' During the weekly Syracuse University football player\coach interviews on Tuesday October 13th 2015, freshman quarterback Eric Dungey talked for the first time about his concussion against Central Michigan. Stephen D. Cannerelli | scannerelli@syracuse.com
